summary.p: This is volume one of two of a copy of the Caturakarāti, by Beschi, entitled Dictionnaire Malabar on its title page. The second part is BnF Indien 229
In this volume is found the first part of Beschi's Caturakarāti, that is, the Pēyarakarāti (presumably Peyarakarāti), a dictionary on nouns.
Description by Neela Bhaskar based on the digital images available on Gallica.

filiation.p: BnF Indien 229 is the volume 2 of this 2-volume manuscript.

supportDesc.foliation: Parallel Tamil and Arabic numerals on the recto, left margin, for U2. Consistently foliated.

collation.desc: 1 folio = Caturakarāti: Title Page. No foliation. 410 x 35 mm.
199 folios = Caturakarāti: Text. Tamil foliation 1-199 and parallel Arabic foliation. 415 x 35 mm.
1 folio = guard leaf. No foliation. Blank recto verso.

handNote.desc: Even the short e is rendered with a double kompu, that is used for the long ē.

binding.p: Original brown wood covers. 410 x 35 mm.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Dated to 1828 on the basis of the date of BnF Indien 229 (second part of this dictionary). Dated to 1828 by Vinson et al. (1866-) and to 1828 by Cabaton (1912). By Ducler's scribe, working around 1830. Probably not before 1828 (date of the earliest internally dated Ducler's manuscript). Not later than its first mention (Burnouf 1832).

provenance.p: Copied for Philippe Ducler by an unnamed copyist in Karaikal Jail. See Burnouf (1832).

acquisition.p: Acquired, July 22nd, 1833, from Philippe Ducler. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 1 = Acquisitions: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1833-1848, no. 70.

listBibl.bibl: Burnouf, Eugène. 1832. Rapport fait au Conseil, dans la séance du 2 juillet 1832, sur les collections de manuscrits et de dessins rapportées de l’Inde par M. Ducler, administrateur de Carical, membre de la Société asiatique. Journal asiatique 10, p. 84-87. — See p. 87, no. 3.
Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 37, nos. 228-229.
Velanguani Arokium [Vēḷāṅkaṇṇi Ārōkkiyam]. 1845. Catalogue des manuscrits tamouls de la Bibliothèque royale. BnF NAF 5443. — See p. 16, nos. 26-27.
Vinson, Julien & Feer, Léon & s.n. 1866-. Catalogue des manuscrits tamoul et télinga. Manuscript, BnF Indien 577. — See f. 54rr, nos. 213-214 228-229.

encodingDesc.p: I have added puḷḷis in my transcription, and rendered even the hypercorrected ē as such. Thus, I surmise that pēyarakarāti is peyarakarāti, "the dictionary on nouns".
